ranges.notes: New Year's Day (Jan 1) is a public holiday. Three Kings celebration (Jan 5-6) features a grand parade through Toledo's medieval streets and is the main gift-giving tradition in Spain. January 6 is a public holiday.

Low season with few tourists and excellent hotel value. Cold winter temperatures averaging 5-10°C, but clear days offer beautiful light for photography of the historic city. Winter sales begin mid-January in all shops and department stores.
Low season continues with few crowds at major monuments. Cold but often clear days make for excellent sightseeing if properly dressed.

Modest carnival celebrations compared to other Spanish cities, but with street parades, costume contests, and traditional foods available throughout the historic center. Usually falls in February but occasionally in early March depending on the Easter calendar.
Early spring brings warming temperatures and almond blossoms in the surrounding countryside. Excellent time for photography with fewer tourists and beautiful light on the historic buildings.
As Easter approaches, brotherhoods prepare their processions with rehearsals sometimes visible throughout the city. Cultural activities increase as spring approaches.

ranges.event: Semana Santa (Holy Week - varies by year)
ranges.notes: Toledo's Holy Week processions are among the most solemn and authentic in Spain, featuring ancient brotherhoods carrying elaborate pasos (floats) through the narrow medieval streets. Evening processions are particularly dramatic against the historic backdrop.
Perfect spring weather with warm days and cool evenings. Ideal time to visit with the countryside in bloom. Tourist numbers increase but remain manageable.
Public holiday with reduced opening hours at some attractions. Many locals enjoy outdoor activities in the countryside.
Excellent time to visit with perfect temperatures for walking. The surrounding countryside is lush and green. Outdoor cafes and restaurants fully operational.
The city begins preparing for the important Corpus Christi festival with decorations appearing on buildings and in plazas.

Toledo's most important religious festival (dates vary but typically in June) when the entire historic center is adorned with centuries-old tapestries, awnings, and decorations, culminating in a grand procession with the monstrance through streets carpeted with herbs and flowers.
Early summer brings consistent warm weather with temperatures becoming quite hot by mid-day. Morning and evening are ideal for sightseeing.
Midsummer celebration on June 23-24 with smaller events in Toledo and larger celebrations in surrounding villages. Traditional bonfires and festivities mark the summer solstice.

Jazz festival featuring performances in historic venues throughout the city, including outdoor concerts in atmospheric courtyards and plazas. Hot daytime temperatures make evening cultural activities preferable.

Public holiday on August 15 with religious observances. Peak summer season with very hot temperatures often exceeding 35°C, making midday sightseeing uncomfortable. Many locals leave the city for vacation during this period.

Hottest period of the year with some businesses closed for summer holidays. Early morning and late evening are the only comfortable times for walking in the city. Tourist numbers remain high despite the heat.
Excellent time to visit as summer heat begins to moderate but days remain sunny and warm. Tourist numbers decrease from August peaks.
The surrounding La Mancha region prepares for the saffron harvest with special food events and cultural activities highlighting this precious local crop.
The brief and precious saffron harvest occurs in the surrounding La Mancha region, with special tours and culinary events celebrating 'red gold' in nearby villages like Consuegra.
National holiday commemorating Columbus's arrival in the Americas, with military parades in Madrid and reduced hours at some attractions.

Perfect autumn weather with mild temperatures ideal for sightseeing and photography. Fall colors begin to appear in parks and the surrounding countryside. Excellent time for cultural visits with reduced tourist numbers.
Public holiday with traditional cemetery visits and special services. Many businesses closed or operating reduced hours.

Cooler temperatures but still pleasant for sightseeing with significantly fewer tourists. Fall colors peak in early November. Museums and indoor attractions particularly appealing. Game cuisine featured in local restaurants during hunting season.
Public holidays on December 6 (Constitution) and December 8 (Immaculate Conception) creating a 'puente' (bridge) holiday period with increased domestic tourism

Toledo's historic center is beautifully decorated for Christmas with special lighting and elaborate nativity scenes (belenes) in churches, public buildings, and squares. The narrow medieval streets create a particularly magical Christmas atmosphere.
Public holiday with limited opening hours. Unlike northern Europe, December 26 is not a holiday in Spain.
Post-Christmas period with continued holiday atmosphere and decorations throughout the city. Cold but festive with increased domestic tourism between Christmas and New Year.
Celebrations in Plaza del Ayuntamiento (Town Hall Square) with the tradition of eating 12 grapes at midnight. Many restaurants offer special New Year's Eve menus.

scoreDescription.5: Excellent: Perfect conditions, special events, ideal weather, moderate crowds
scoreDescription.4: Good: Very favorable conditions, pleasant weather, manageable crowds
scoreDescription.3: Average: Standard conditions, typical weather, moderate to high tourism
scoreDescription.2: Below Average: Less ideal conditions, possibly unpleasant weather or very low/high tourism (business closures)
scoreDescription.1: Poor: Unfavorable conditions, extreme weather, overcrowded or very limited activities
